ngiemboon: Á laa na mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, Yoyanda cʉ́ʼʉ tántʉ̀, pâ metándá mekatúʼ pʉ̀a nkÿo gwa kʉ̀a: Wɔɔn laa Azaliya míŋ Yelowam, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Esemayɛ̂ɛ míŋ Yoyanaŋ, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Azaliya míŋ Obɛd, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Maseya míŋ Andaya, ńgÿo Elishÿafa míŋ Zikili.
en: Then, in the seventh year,   Jehoiada summoned his courage and took the commanders of hundreds into a covenant with him: Azariah son of Jeroham, Ishmael son of Jehohanan, Azariah son of Obed, Maaseiah son of Adaiah, and Elishaphat son of Zichri.

ngiemboon: Pɔɔn pʉ̀a la giŋe tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Yúndà. Pɔ́ la cúʼte pʉ̀a Lěvî, mbɔɔ patyé twómvfò na metsìŋendá pa Ésàlayɛ, tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ ntsèm. Afʉ̀ʼ la kuʼ, pâ pɔ̌ piŋ né Yelúzálèm,
en: They made a circuit throughout Judah. They gathered the Levites from all the cities of Judah and the family heads of Israel, and they came to Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ mbàŋa ntsèm cúʼte ndá Ssé. Pâ fùɔ gwa kʉ̀a. Yoyanda gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Míŋ fùɔ zɔ ge gÿo gwɔ́ fùɔ, páʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gɔɔn ntí penkʉ́ fùɔ Ndavîd.
en: Then the whole assembly made a covenant with the king in God’s temple. Jehoiada said to them, “Here is the king’s son! He will reign, just as the Lord promised   concerning David’s sons.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie pi ge gÿo gÿo ayɔɔn: Á ge gÿo gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ gie panuŋepwɔʼ lâ pʉ̀a Lěvî zyeté fàʼa yɔ́b, á lyɛʼɛ́ nzse, atsɔ́ nùɔ ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ mencwò ndá Ssé.
en: This is what you are to do: a third of you, priests and Levites who are coming on duty on the Sabbath,   are to be gatekeepers.

ngiemboon: Anùɔ mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a ne ḿbyɛ́be mendá nɔʼ, anùɔ mbɔ́ɔntè yétá ne ḿbyɛ́be ncwò ndá gẅie mé tóŋo lê ncwò cÿó ndá. Aláʼ ntsèm ge láʼ tyé tetʉ́a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: A third are to be at the king’s palace, and a third are to be at the Foundation Gate, and all the troops will be in the courtyards of the Lord’s temple.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ké le ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a kú, ndàʼ panuŋepwɔʼ, ńgÿo pʉ̀a Lěvî pie é gẅiin fàʼ. À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ kúu wó, mélàʼmie mé la zɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́b. Aláʼa ntsèm ge gÿo kúʼte wɔɔn ntÿɔgɔ́ gẅie éfóo mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: No one is to enter the Lord’s temple but the priests and those Levites who serve;   they may enter because they are holy, but all the people are to obey the requirement of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a Lěvî ge gÿo kúʼte shúm ncù sɔ́b, é tÿɔ́ʼte fùɔ, pâ pɔ̌ gʉa jʉʼ ntsèm gie à gee né wó. Ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn faʼa lékúu ndá Ssé, mé zẅé yé.»
en: The Levites are to completely surround the king with weapons in hand. Anyone who enters the temple is to be put to death. Accompany the king in all his daily tasks.”

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Lěvî mbɔɔ pʉ̀a Yúndà ntsèm la gÿo mmó gie Yoyanda nùŋepwɔʼ la gɔɔn. Awɛ̌ tándá wɔ́ɔ la cúʼte pʉ̀a pé, epʉ̀a pie é lɔ́ɔn ńzye yɔ́b fàʼ, á lyɛʼɛ́ nzse, mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie é lɔ́ɔn ḿmaga yɔ́b na yɛ̌ lyɛ̌ʼ. Mélàʼmie Yoyanda la te zẅíŋ ngie atsɔ́ nùɔ gʉa ńzẅɛte wɔ́.
en: So the commanders of hundreds did everything the priest Jehoiada commanded. They each brought their men #— #those coming on duty on the Sabbath and those going off duty on the Sabbath #— #for the priest Jehoiada did not release the divisions.

ngiemboon: Yoyanda la ná mekwoŋ mbɔɔ memǎa mekʉ́ʼʉ ncù pâ púɔ mekʉ́ʼʉ ncù mie é la tyé ndá Ssé, ńgwɔ́ me fùɔ Ndavîd, á mbwó metándá palÿɔ́ʼncù pie é sáʼa pʉ̀a nkÿo.
en: The priest Jehoiada gave to the commanders of hundreds King David’s spears, shields, and quivers   that were in God’s temple.

ngiemboon: À la tÿɔ́g pʉ̀a pé, pɔ́ gẅiin shúm ncù mbwó, tà fó na gwoŋó pwó tʉ̀, ńgʉa ńkúu na gwoŋó pwó kyɛ̀bɛ na ndá, á ngʉ̀ŋe jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, mbɔɔ ngʉ̀ŋe ndá, á lélɔg ńtÿɔ́ʼte fùɔ.
en: Then he stationed all the troops with their weapons in hand surrounding the king #— #from the right side of the temple to the left side, by the altar and by the temple.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼ kuʼ, mé lɔgɔ Yohásè ńtó, Yoyanda pâ penkʉ́ pé tɔʼɔ cÿɔ̀ʼɔ lefùɔ twó yé, ńná meŋwàʼne kʉ̀a né yé. Ńdeen ńké ḿpfɛte mevɛ́ twó yé, ńzɔ́ʼɔ yé, ńdɔg ńgÿo fùɔ: Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ zye lékwéʼe ngyè ye ńgɔɔn ngie: «guugẅî mbwó fùɔ!»
en: They brought out the king’s son, put the crown on him, gave him the testimony,   and made him king. Jehoiada and his sons anointed him and cried, “Long live the king! ”  # 23:11 1Sm 10:24

ngiemboon: Atalia la júʼ páʼ aláʼ ne ńkága, ńne náa guugẅî mbwó fùɔ, ńnɔ́ɔnte ńkẅɛ́te wɔ́b ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: When Athaliah heard the noise from the troops, the guards, and those praising the king, she went to the troops in the Lord’s temple.

ngiemboon: Ńgyá páʼ fùɔ wesẅé, á tyé ngʉ̀ŋe ntóon, lé shÿó ncwò ndá, metándá palÿɔ́ʼncù pâ patóŋ ntaŋ, é tyéte lejʉ́ŋ yé: Aláʼa ntsèm ne ńkága, papúʼ leluŋó ne ńtóŋo ntaŋ. Pazɔb ntse ne ńdɔgɔ shúm leluŋó sɔ́b ḿbímte. Atalia gyá púʼu, éshʉate menzsǒ mbùm yé, ńne ńdíte ngwòŋ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Yée menáŋ lê! Yée menáŋ lê!»
en: As she looked, there was the king standing by his pillar   at the entrance. The commanders and the trumpeters were by the king, and all the people of the land were rejoicing and blowing trumpets  # 23:13 Nm 10:7–10 while the singers with musical instruments were leading the praise. Athaliah tore her clothes and screamed, “Treason! Treason! ”

ngiemboon: Yoyanda la te kwoŋ ngie mé zẅé yé á tsɛ̀ɛ ndá Ssé wɔ́. Aa yɛ̌ tá à la tsẅii mbwó metándá pie é sáʼa palÿɔ́ʼncù nkÿo ngie: «Pi fó nùɔ pi, ńkẅile yé; Nyìŋ piŋ faʼa lézse nzèm yé, pi zẅé yé.»
en: Then the priest Jehoiada sent out the commanders of hundreds, those in charge of the army, saying, “Take her out between the ranks, and put anyone who follows her to death by the sword,” for the priest had said, “Don’t put her to death in the Lord’s temple.”

ngiemboon: Mé la shwoŋte yé, ńdɔg ńcwóŋ lé tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼ, ńgʉa tá ńkúu ncwò nkáʼ gẅie mé tóŋo lê nkáʼ melÿóon, ńzẅé yé.
en: So they arrested her, and she went by the entrance of the Horse Gate   to the king’s palace, where they put her to death.

ngiemboon: Yoyanda pâ láʼ mbɔɔ fùɔ, é la gwa kʉ̀a, á tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ayɛ̌ kʉ̀a lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ gie á gÿo, pɔ́ lɔgɔ ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Then Jehoiada made a covenant between himself, the king, and the people that they would be the Lord’s people.

ngiemboon: Á cʉa púʼu, aláʼ kúu ndá ssé Mbâa, ńtág yɛ̌ ndá, ḿbú ńtág mejʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ mé, mbɔɔ metútú, ńdeen ńké ńgʉa mvfò jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, ńzẅé Mataŋ gẅie aa nùŋepwɔʼ messé Mbâa.
en: So all the people went to the temple of Baal and tore it down. They smashed its altars and images and killed Mattan, the priest of Baal, at the altars.

ngiemboon: Yoyanda leen ńké ńcʉ́me nò lélíe ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a á mbwó panuŋepwɔʼ pe Lěvî. Afùɔ Ndavîd tÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b menùɔ menùɔ páʼ pɔ́ ge nuŋe pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ ndá Ssé, á gwɔ́ páʼ mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê púʼu. À la tsẅi né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ lɔg mezɔ̀bɔ ntse lekág tá faʼa yɛ̌ fàʼ.
en: Then Jehoiada put the oversight of the Lord’s temple into the hands of the Levitical priests,   whom David had appointed  # 23:18 1Ch 23:6,25–31 over the Lord’s temple, to offer burnt offerings to the Lord as it is written in the law of Moses,  # 23:18 2Kg 14:6; 2Ch 17:9; Ezr 7:6; Neh 8:1 with rejoicing and song ordained by  # 23:18 Lit song on the hands of David.

ngiemboon: Yoyanda la gíŋ ńtÿɔ́g papyɛ́b mencwò ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Tá à cʉa púʼu, nyìŋ gẅie ncÿǒ ée na yé, á lé wó kú.
en: He stationed gatekeepers   at the gates of the Lord’s temple so that nothing unclean could enter for any reason.

ngiemboon: Yoyanda gíŋe ńcúʼte metándá pasáʼ palÿɔ́ʼncù nkÿo, mbɔɔ mekěm, mbɔɔ pasáʼa láʼ, ńgÿo láʼa ntsèm, pɔ́ fó ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńdɔgɔ fùɔ ḿpfó na ncwò ndá welÿò, ńgʉa nɔʼ ńtsege yé. Ńdeen ńké ńnéŋe yé na lʉŋe lefùɔ.
en: Then he took with him the commanders of hundreds, the nobles, the governors of the people, and all the people of the land and brought the king down from the Lord’s temple. They entered the king’s palace through the Upper Gate and seated the king on the throne of the kingdom.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a metsèm la pú ńkág.
en: All the people of the land rejoiced, and the city was quiet, for they had put Athaliah to death by the sword.
